page.description: A web project contains and organizes the files that you will publish. Alpha Anywhere places these files in a directory structure under the Alpha Anywhere program folder. You may have as many projects as you need, each with a distinctive name. The Web Projects Control Panel provides a view of these projects. It also organizes all of the files used in your web projects. Here you can:

case.description: Create or delete named web projects
Shape and manage pages
Design grid web components that connect with your database's tables, views, and queries.
Develop UX web components that act like forms, accept information from, and return information to users
Fashion grid linker and tabbed grid linker components, which integrate multiple grids components into a single control
Construct navigation components that integrate your application with menus
Devise login components that control who can enter your application
Make Reports and Xbasic Modules.
Generate and edit cascading style sheets
Manage all page components (including ancillary files, such as images and style sheets)
Forge application variables that will be available to all pages within a project
Preview any grid, dialog, or page component in your Internet browser
Build folder aliases that make your projects able to run in different folders on different computers
Form one or more profiles that define how and where to publish your finished pages
Publish your finished pages to local (LAN) servers using Windows networking services or remote servers using FTP

section.title: Open the Web Projects Control Panel:

step.description: To open the Web Projects Control Panel, click Web Projects on the main toolbar.

section.title: Viewing a Project's Files
section.description: To view the files used in a project, select the project name from the drop-down list box at top left. To see all files in the project "All Files". To filter the list of files shown, select any of the following:

case.description: "Web Components"
"A5WPages"
"HTML Pages"
"Javascript Files"
"CSS Style Sheets"
"Images"
"Reports (Project)"
"Xbasic"
"Web Services"
"Node"
"All Files"

case.title: Recently Selected Projects
case.description: Shows the recently selected web projects.

case.title: New Component or File
case.description: Opens the New File Dialog. You can create A5W, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Xbasic functions and Modules, and Web Component Files here.

case.title: Create A New Grid Component
case.description: Open the Grid Builder after first opening the Select Grid Component Template dialog.

case.title: Add File
case.description: Opens a Windows dialog that lets you add a file from your computer.

case.title: Edit File
case.description: Opens a file to be edited in the Builder or Editor that corresponds to the file's type.

case.title: Delete File
case.description: Deletes a file.

case.title: New Project
case.description: Opens the Select Project Template and creates a new project.

case.title: Publish
case.description: Lets you publish your applications to the Web, so that your users can use it.

case.title: Security
case.description: Lets you set the security for your project, for all of its components, pages, users, and more.

case.title: Project Properties
case.description: Allows you to set properties for your web project. When you publish a project these properties are publish with it.

case.title: Working Preview
case.description: Allows you to run a file without having to turn on the server. The Working Preview is useful for debugging in this regard.

case.title: Open Project Folder in Windows Explorer
case.description: Opens Windows Explorer so you can easily open your Alpha Anywhere from Windows. You can also access Windows Explorer by click Edit > Open Project in Explorer.

case.title: Cordova
case.description: Allows you to build applications that run on mobile phones.

section.title: Finding a File
section.description: To find a file select Edit > Search in all Web Project files... to display the Search Web Project dialog. Enter text to search for and click Search. To edit an object, select it in the list and click Edit Object.

section.title: Web Projects Control Panel - Filter
section.description: The Web Projects Control Panel has a filter prompt. This is useful when you have a large number of files in a web project and you want to find a file quickly. The list of files displayed will automatically change to match whatever you type. The Filter: is in the top right corner on the Web Projects Control Panel toolbar.

step.description: Start typing the name or extension of the File you want to find. You can select All Files in the File Type menu to search your entire project.

section.title: Show the Web Projects Control Panel Automatically for a Workspace
section.description: The File|Workspace Properties menu has a setting that allows you to automatically open either the Web Projects Control Panel or the desktop control panel when your Workspace opens. This way you can go directly to the set of tools you use most frequently in Alpha Anywhere.

step.description: Open the File drop-down on the Alpha Anywhere toolbar and click on Workspace Properties.
The Workspace Properties Dialog will open. On the Startup tab select Web Applications Control Panel in the 'Control Panel to show when this Workspace is opened:' drop-down.
The Web Projects Control Panel should now open when you open your workspace.
